item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Michael Phelps breaks world record in 100-meter butterfly, beating Milorad Cavic
item.description: Michael Phelps set a world record, beating rival Milorad Cavic at the world swimming championships in the 100-meter butterfly.

item.dc:creator: John Clayton
item.title: Derrick Mason shows to Baltimore Ravens training camp with intentions on playing
item.description: Ravens receiver Derrick Mason showed up in training camp at McDaniels College in Westmister, Md., and is gong to end his retirement.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Michael Crabtree absent as San Francisco 49ers' training camp opens
item.description: Michael Crabtree is a no-show at San Francisco 49ers training camp.

item.dc:creator: Terry Blount
item.title: Tony Stewart wrecks car during NASCAR Sprint Cup Pocono practice
item.description: NASCAR points leader Tony Stewart wrecked his car during practice at Pocono Raceway and had to go to a backup car.

item.dc:creator: External
item.title: In progress: Tiger chasing lead at Buick Open
item.description: In-progress third round scores from the Buick Open.

item.dc:creator: John Clayton
item.title: New York Giants reach agreement with first-round pick Hakeem Nicks
item.description: The New York Giants and their first-round pick, Hakeem Nicks, have agreed on a five-year deal.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: The Chicago White Sox acquire Jake Peavy in a 4-for-1 deal
item.description: The Chicago White Sox acquire Jake Peavy in a 4-for-1 deal.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Brazilian police: Arturo Gatti hung himself from staircase more than seven feet off ground
item.description: Boxer Arturo Gatti's body has been exhumed, and the Quebec coroner's office will perform a new autopsy at his family's request.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Hawaii Warriors coach Greg McMackin suspended 30 days for gay slur against Notre Dame Fighting Irish
item.description: Hawaii coach Greg McMackin is being suspended for 30 days and voluntarily taking a pay cut for making a derogatory comment while describing Notre Dame's chant before last year's Hawaii Bowl.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady says recontructed knee OK, arm getting there
item.description: Patriots quarterback Tom Brady expects to play in exhibition games next month -- his first action since injuring his knee in the 2008 regular season opener.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: John Daly losing feel in hands, confidence in game
item.description: John Daly felt as though he hit rock bottom Friday with his worst score ever in a regular PGA Tour event that left him wondering whether he should quit.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Lee tosses dominant CG in 1st start with Phillies
item.description: Cliff Lee spotted his fastball with precision, and his curveball, too. What a National League debut for the reigning AL Cy Young Award winner.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: MLB trade deadline: Boston Red Sox's pursuit of Victor Martinez of Cleveland Indians heats up
item.description: The Boston Red Sox have agreed to a deal to acquire All-Star slugger Victor Martinez from the Cleveland Indians.

item.dc:creator: Scott Burnside
item.title: Sources: NHL investigates Marion Hossa, Chris Pronger contracts
item.description: The NHL is investigating Marian Hossa's 12-year, $62.8 million contract with the Chicago Blackhawks.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: MLB Trade: Jarrod Washburn of the Seattle Mariners traded to the Detroit Tigers
item.description: The Seattle Mariners have traded left-handed pitcher Jarrod Washburn to the Detroit Tigers for rookie left-hander Luke French and a minor league pitcher, sources tell ESPN.
